name: BIT.TRIP RUNNER
description: CommanderVideo is back with BIT.TRIP RUNNER, the latest chapter on Steam in the award-winning and critically acclaimed BIT.TRIP series. Launch special: 10% off now thru Mar. 6th!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 Processor: 2.0+ GHz Memory: 512 MB DirectX®: DirectX® 9.0c and shader model 3 with 128 MB of memory Hard Drive: 100 MB Sound: Any sound card capable of stereo output

reviews.review_text: This game makes me want to break things.

Frustration deluxe.  Ok so the game and concept is simple, your character constantly run to the right and you have to slide, jump, kick, bounce, reflect or any of these combinations together to get to the end of the level. The music that plays in the background helps you keep the pace somewhat and you can probably blindfold this game if you memorize it completely.  But the bad thing about the game, is that you have one try.  If you fail in any way, you will start at the beginning of the level. The first few levels are easy, but the further in you get into a chapter, the levels get both longer and more complicated, some lasting up to 4-5 minutes. So the game turns into a game or memorizing every little thing, you have to remember which buttons to press and for how long to press them as well, some things you get barely no warning of at all so the first time you get there, you will die.  Fun.  So the game itself is pretty fun, except the lack of checkpoints, which makes it extremely frustrating instead.  Graphics: It’s pretty if you like this 3d-pixel environment. It works well I think. :) Things kind of tend to blur together at times, but might be intentional to make it harder.  Technically I had no real hiccups, though I experienced some light lags at times, but think it might be my computer instead of the game. 99% of the time it was smooth sailing.  So should you buy this? Well, I don’t know, some might like this a lot, perfecting levels is a wonderful feeling, but if you are forced to perfect them… Well, it just sucks the fun out of a game. If you don’t mind this, then you should probably buy it. It is a good game in the bottom, but the frustrating stuff really tended to get in the way for me.

ok before you buy note:it is a rage game but i am a rager yet i diidnt reage once i dont know maybe it was the music maybe it is the cute animation but it dosent make me rage i mean music fantastic and when you get to rainbow you like wahhhhh chaaaaaaaaa so this is a great game but i recommend when it gose on sale to get it top price 6 bux this game is a rating of 8/10 GJ

The game's timing is far too dang strict for not including any checkpoints whatsoever.  It is very fun, and very unique. However, it is far more frustrating than it is either of those.  Give it a pass unless you can get it for under a buck.

Hate this game. Hard to look at -- constant attempts to focus on blurry foreground objects cause eye fatigue. You need a precision gaming keyboard to play it with any success. It's so repetitive. The gimmicks that make it interesting get old and boring, since they just repeat endlessly. So pointless. So frustrating. Punishes you for the slightest tiniest misstep by forcing you to re-do overly long levels from the beginning. Seriously, I hate it so much.

i've had this game since 2011 and I go back to it every few months but I can never beat the first chapter, from what I've seen the story is of a mentally handicapped ninja from space crash landing on an unfamiliar planet and attempting to converse with the new lifeforms through interprative dance, techno music and sprinting

This game is great. i have a lot of time playing it on the Wii original. It can be both the funnest and most frustrating game in existence. Lovers of electronic music and platformers will love this game. The 8-bit art is simply magnificent, and much more interesting than the second Bit.Trip Runner's art. Highly recommend this game.

(This game was provided by TAPbagan. Thanks, TAP! )  Short, sweet, to the point....yet frustrating. A new-age retro (hippie) game that'll give you the satisfaction of Atari gaming days with an aftertaste of Nyan Cat.   A satisfying game with a satisfying rhythm.   If you find this game cheap, you'll be pleasantly surprised. Only flaws? It's frustratingly difficult (but nowhere near impossible), and it's tragically short.
Very fun and active game it will keep you occupied for a very long time.

Pain in the rear end. Difficult frustrating and difficult unfair, not difficult challenging. Don't buy this expecting a rhythm game; it's a pattern-learning game, and often the patterns aren't tied to the rhythm and trying to keep in time will screw you up.
If you want to have fun and be frustrated at the same time, this is the game for you.
Challenging, unforgiving, frustrating....but I still manage to have another go and try to beat the levels.
Bland runner with headache inducing graphics and sound.
Endless runner that eventually asks you to have absolutely perfect timing in order to succeed. Screw up? No checkpoint, start from the beginning.  Ragequit, uninstall.
All I have to say is that this is an entertaining game with an AMAZING sound track! I have to say though, I get pretty rage...
Hard as balls, but also fun as balls. Overall, I'd give it four balls out of five.
This game can take a while to get use to, but its worth it. BIT.TRIP RUNNER is an amazing game that has beautiful art and melodious music.

Below mediocre. Button-presser with hardly any depth. Uses pixel art as an excuse for skimping on graphics. Ultimately not worth the buy unless you enjoy pressing buttons and listening to bad techno music.

How is there a 'full controller support'?am i missing something. . .without 3rd party software you have ZERO controller support.  First off,it's a $hitty port from Wii;it was cr4p back then,and it still is,just worse.I do realize that it's a fast-paced,rhythm platformer,but game constantly fails at hitbox detection and designation;it aslo has 'NATIVE' input lag for some reason.I don't remember wii version having that.It was much more fluent as a console iteration,and steam one just keeps swallowing commands on and off.What's up with that??O_o  I dunno. . .i haven't played runner2 on wiiU since i don't own that console,so i won't be able to compare the two,but i sincerely hope that pc runner2 is much better than this steaming pile.
Yeah, just way too frustrating, no checkpoints, you simply have to start all over and memorize the levels. I don't see the fun, others do.
This game almost made me kill myself.

Fun, but hard. It has its own style, catchy game-driven music, but it's just not for me. I don't catch on to the rapid button-perfection type games, it's a violent mix of fun and frustration every few seconds, and I can't get past the first few levels without getting ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off. Oh well. It's good for what it is. 5/10
This game is hard and I hate it.

In Normal-Difficulty, I couldn't get up the stairs. So, I switched to Easy Mode. As best I can tell, the only difference is they took out the in-stage bonuses, and the subsequent bonus stage. I was unable to identify how the obstacles had been eased. I still couldn't get up the stairs.
Score: 5/10  It was... ok. Honestly I see this as fun for a phone game. I'm giving it a no as a pc game. I really can't pick up and play for more then 10 minutes without getting bored with it.
An amazing and beautiful game.  You get the reward of listening to amazing music! :D
BIT.TRIP RUNNER is a mind blowing game with jumping, wait thats it just jumping, [torture device]
God damn it. This game is so amazing, Good soundtrack to play along with. and endless hours of keyboard smashing. WARNING you will need a new keyboard after playing this.

This game is really fun and I would play it anytime if I'm bored or upset to cheer me up. I only just started playing it but I really love it so far! I can't explain how fun this game is so this is hard to write but basically all I'm trying to say is everyone should play it as it's so fun.

Um... i've been Playing this game for less than 1 Hour. A thing i understood perfectly is that this Game is (Other than Looking great) pretty Unforgiving. And Fast-Paced. These two Factors are a Bit Volatile toghether, creating a Deadly mix of 'HURRY!' and 'WATCH OUT!'. Still neat little Game, definitely Worth Buying.

You run at blazing speeds through sidescrolling levels jumping over, sliding under and kicking obstacles while collecting gold and multipliers. Everyone gets the same score on the level by collecting all the gold, then there's a bonus level afterward which is the place you earn your spot on the leaderboards by collecting more gold than others have.   Meaning if you want to try at a higher score you have to redo the entire level just to play the bonus level again, which is a surprisingly stupid mechanic. Game's alright for a brief romp and does take some skill and reflex, but ultimately it's just that -- alright. People who love the indie retro graphics/tunes scene will squee.
is pretty okay. 11/10
A really fun and relaxing game

A simple rhythm game at first, BIT.TRIP RUNNER quickly takes a turn for the brutal, especially if you play on 'perfect' difficulty. While the music and visuals are some of the best I've seen in an indie game, the levels induced SMB levels of rage on occasion.  Pick this one up if you're looking for a fun, challenging game that you don't have to play for hours at a time. 7/10

Another adventure in the Bit.Trip series, this time it's a rhythm based platformer! Jump over obstacles, collect gold, and defeat bosses as you run along different landscapes to funky beats. Some of the later levels can get pretty tricky though so be warned! Especially with the lack of checkpoints.. 7/10

This game is one of the hardest games i ever played. After failing about 12 times in a row i finally complete the level. The music and the sound effects make this game very fun and nice. But the game gets really frustating after some time. The graphics are not that good but that doesn't matter at this sorts of games. This game is a real challenge and sometimes you love and and sometimes you just want to throw the game away and poop on it.  I'm giving this spastic game a 8/10
Frustrating garbage coated with a 8bit retro design.
Commander Video does cool kicks and tricks but isn't good with stairs

If you didn't get a chance to check this game out on the Wii, now it's on Steam for your enjoyment!  Those who have played it on the Wii console will appreciate how much more crisp the PC iteration is visually and can now enjoy some Steam achievments for this title. Don't worry about learning new controls: it has gamepad compatibility and the defaults are so similar that you'll likely not notice much of a difference.  Bit.Trip Runner is a simple, straightforward game that bleeds nostalgia while bringing its own charm to the table.
It makes me feel happy, it´s challenging but beautiful.

Does this game make you rage? Yes, yes it does. However, it does so in such a fun and bouncy way that even when you scream 'I'M RAGE QUITTING', you have to play the level a few more times just to make sure you're making the right decision. The music is very bouncy and fun to listen to, and fits the game perfectly. WIthout such a great soundtrack, this game would be nowhere near as enjoyable. A warning: THIS GAME IS ADDICTIVE.

This game is a mixed bag really. Its pretty cool. Its kind of music-driven and has a very kickass OST. The music is awesome and during game it gets more upbeat as you go. The visuals were okay. A little weird considering the backgrounds are 3d but the character is a very plain sprite. I didn't really like that mix. There's 3 worlds and there's a handful of levels in each so it has enough content in it.  Unfortuantely, I just didn't think the game was great. One mistake and allllll the way back to the start. Its a difficult game, but its difficulty isn't something it should be proud of like SMB is. Its just a memorization test. Trial and error nonstop. Memorizing certain patterns. I don't find that very entertaining.  I felt like this game was just wasted potential. They should of made it more about score and less about memorizing hard patterns. It also would of benefited from less linear gameplay with multiple paths to choose from.  Fortunately, not only does the sequel do that but it also adds checkpoints. Its better in many other ways as well. I suggest you skip this one and play Runner 2 instead.
My eyes hurt.
Really challenging game, not for the faint of heart. The sense of 'Woah, how did I just do that?' is awesome though.
Nice retro graphics, fun, but sometimes hard!

Don't even bother. I've played a ton of rhythm games including Guitar Hero 4, Elite Beat Agents, Rhythm Heaven, Osu and Mother 3 so I can safely say this game doesn't  feel  right. The timing of jumps feels awkward and there's no audio indication if an obstacle is coming up. The difficulty spike at 1-11 is absolutely ridiculous and for a rhythm game, it's horrible because you could play it if you were practically deaf. Don't buy it.
it's... so... addictive...
do it for her
8 bit graphics...... And real hard and challenging!  2.5/5
Game for hardcore players, ♥♥♥♥ing rage inducer.

Its like they took the brutal jet bike level from Battletoads and decided to make an entire nightmarish game out of it. The soundtrack is an 8-year-old playing with a music sequencer/synth app on an iphone. Kudos to the devs for giving us one of the few black protagonists in gaming but don't play this game unless you hate yourself.
Music plays and you run! Avoid and destroy a variety of obstacles! An inspiring tale! 5/10

This game is painfully difficult and ultimately more frustrating than fun. There are no checkpoints; one mistake means you have to start all over, and the levels are quite long. Sadly, only the truly hardcore of hardcore gamers and masochists will be capable of finding this enjoyable. Fortunately, its sequel, Runner 2, solves these problems by adding checkpoints and variable difficulty. So skip this one and check out Runner 2 if this kind of game appeals to you.
BIT.TRIP RUNNER Is about as fun as counting the hairs on your ballsack, and I can do that for free.
like Temple run but with pixel graphics and not as fun. avoid.
If you love annoying retro music and difficult games and buying new keyboards this game is for you! But who am I kidding, I bout it while it was on sale for 1 dollar
Annoying platformer with cute music. Restart level from beginning when you die.
Awesome game very addicting. I would recommend.  9/10 Soundtrack  10/10 Gameplay  8.5/10 Replayability.
Not even 30 minutes...   I wanna puke...    10/10 would puke again to my heart content
Addicting, 8bit graphics, catchy music
At the end it wasn't that hard but still gg

This is all Fun and games for about 45 minutes.... THEN ONCE YOU GET TO THE LAST LEVEL OF THE FIRST CHAPTER IT LASTS 5 MINUTES STRAIGHT AND IF U F*** UP ........... U RESTART THE WHOLE DAMN THING THIS IS FUN BUT THIS IS JUST BULLS*** I recommend it
Leaky Krinkston, I found and murdered you :D

Reminiscent of Canabalt, and just as frustratingly difficult.  If you like one shot, click to jump games like Flappy Bird and the wealth of others out there, or are high on some drug of questionable legality, you may enjoy this game. I'm not saying it's a bad game, by any means, it's just not my cup of tea.  Plus the fast sidescrolling is almost impossible to focus on and hurts my eyes after a while.  If it's on sale, you might wan't to give it a shot. I'm leaving my recommendation as a 'No', as I don't think it's worth the £6.99 normal pricetag - but that's just my opinion.

A enlightening game with the sound of Beautiful 8-bit music that matches your gameplay.  What more could you ask for, it's a simple game but isn't too easy because it has challenges but that what makes it fun.  A must have in any Steam Library.

This is a fantastic and challenging platformer, but it's the way the music ties into your actions that make it truly memorable. It does feel a little rough around the edges compared to its sequel, but it's still delightfully fun.

Frustratingly hard. I keep coming back to give it a spin, but the game is so unforgiving of mistakes I usually give up after 5 or 6 retries. Maybe it's me and my rusty reflexes, but even the early levels are very, very hard to finish.
Do not buy this game it is unforgiving ,tedious and the sequel is 1000x better

This is a game with a beautiful art style dragged down by repetitive gameplay that depends on absolutely perfect timing to succeed. The only way to move forward is by memorizing every single level. Not rewarding at all.
I'm tripping abit now i'm now running from the police
Awesome game to play when your other games are updating
(Super) Adddictive, as is the sequel !
This game is so sick,i've became rager thx BIT TRIP RUNNER
can't stop playing. addictive soundtrack and gameplay.
Go out and run rather than play this lame ♥♥♥ game you fat lard
Easy to pick up, but challenging nonetheless. Awesome 8-bit soundtrack!
Good game for 1-2 hours, then it will makes you angry. Rage, rage everywhere :-x
first played this on meh WII, of course was the demo version, loved it, and now I played it on steam
10/10  Awesome Game ! Very good graphic !  Good sounds effects ! Works very good !   But where is the Save game button?????? :D

Basically a flash game you can find online for free but has an improvised catchy tune involved. It's like buying really, good 8-bit song that forces you to play in order to hear it. Expect your space bar, J, or 5 keys to be broken (or your index finger) after an hour of playing.  Summary: The game is demoralizing if you just plain suck, but the music makes up for it.  Obligatory score: 7/10
run run JUST RUN.  Its a really good game, nothing bad at it. Musics are making me happy, and graphics are insane <3

Music is good but controls are unresponsive and delayed. Hard to do something that requires timing when the controls don't respond right. Also the pixel graphics are ♥♥♥♥♥♥ so good luck on reading any menus.
It's a runner game. It's got some nice music too. Gotta say, it's kinda fun on occasion. Not usually in long stretches though.

A lack of checkpoints can make the first few levels on easy difficulty agonizing to play if you don't beat them each in one try.  The '''good''' chiptune music and graphics can't make up for everything.
Run, slide, punch, jump and collect them gold bars.  Great side scrolling runner.  Music is fun and game is challenging.
First: 8 euro? Bad joke,0.79 should be maximum price for this rage unleashing game.Second:I don't like it,it sucks donkey balls.  Smells like ♥♥♥♥

I've played many hours of this offline before I started using Steam.  The retro look and music give it a unique feel and I'm sure it must hold the world record for number of fails per level, it certainly dwarfs all my other games in this respect. You have to try countless times to complete the more difficult levels but that results in a huge sense of achievement when you finally make it. Yes, it does rely on memory a lot of the time but I would consider this a feature rather than the negative given by other reviewers.  I recommend buying both this and Runner2. This is the hard-as-nails expert version and 2 is the beautiful casual version.
Really challenging Indie stuff. Try to beat my highscore on 1-11 - Odyssey :)
It fun.

A lot of people think this ♥♥♥♥ing game is a joke. Well it isn't. It's fun, the music is great and it's challenging in a way that doesn't make you want to bash your head through a ♥♥♥♥ing meat-grinder. Play it, you naysaying ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.

I got this essentially for free in a package I was already buying for other games, and I still feel vaguely ripped off. Dull gameplay, lackluster music. As a rhythm game, there's not much else there.  The music doesn't quite line up with the actions you're supposed to take either -- like, the beats will line up with when you pass over obstacles rather than when you're supposed to initiate the jump. This might be the only rhythm game I can think of that's actually easier when you mute it.

You need A LOT of patience for this game.  Wish this game had checkpoints though.  Do need some sort of rythem, but also need good timing and fast reaction.  Highly recommend starting at Easy.  -----  Check out more games I see that deserve more attention from my curator group:  BluePaw's Underrated Games List  Join and/or follow if you wish.
Checkpoints would be better.   The music was lovely, and provided many minutes of joy. I was gifted it by a kind soul from ♥♥♥♥♥♥ one winters day whilst drinking coffee and posting on image boards.
Really ♥♥♥♥ing hard.
rich, colorful game with great music. it has me raging every time i play it, but i keep coming back for more.

+ fun rhythm game + great soundtrack + good replay options with different difficulties - at times, can be frustratingly hard for those lacking rhythm - levels can be long and failing at the end causes a full restart :(
Game what would lay on the desktop, when are bored.  Going harder and harder each level

Getting all the gold on a stage gives me mad wood.  But then those damn Pitfall themed bonus stages come along and fell my wood like some sort of angry, ♥♥♥♥-smashing lumberjack.  lumberjack.  jumblerlack. bumblerstack. Anyways. 10/10 Would get ♥♥♥♥ sawed off again.
very fun game/addictive
Awesome retro jumper. Its frustrating, but somuch satisfaction when you finish that level that you died about 200 times on.

Most nerve wrecking game i've played in a long time. The colours and background animations hit your eyes and brain pretty bad. When you think you're close to finish a hard level, you'll get hit by an unexpected obstacle and you'll have to start all over again. Been a long time since i completely RQ'd a game, BIT.TRIP came and made it happen again.
♥♥♥♥ this game.
Feel the rush of adrenaline in you blood as the boss drops an obstacle right in front of you or as you miss that fracking platform for the zillionst time. Oh and it has awesome music too!
This game is so cool its 8-bit.
At least it has good music.
After playing this game for 15 minutes i felt confused and my eyes showned me that my desktop screen was moving right, although it didn't.  I think it might be problem with screen refreshing.
best graphics ever so much jumpy slidy fun
Insane Jum'n'Run... easy to get into, hard to master  it's really like someone said 'one more try'
This game brings out the frustration in all! I struggled alot with this game and yet I still haven't beat the first zone! ARGHHHHHHH!
YES. YOU ARE THE BEST $2.50 EVER.

Sometimes this game is so hard and so buggy, that isn't easy to say it's a good game. But if you're not a big baby boy, this game can be really enjoyable. The OST is fantastic and it's integrated part of the game, I love it. The visual is pretty, but sometimes it's annoying, mainly because it can confuse you and make you die a lot of times. In the end, Bit.Trip Runner wasn't the best indie game of all time (how I used to imagine), but it's a good game. As hard as Super Meat Boy, with great musics as Bastion and with a peculiar and pretty visual as Limbo.
Just like BIT.TRIP Beat, another simple 'music game' that gets challenging at times. I'm lovin the BIT.TRIP series and now want to get CORE and VOID. 10/10
Some seriously addictive eyecandy for people who love rythms and retro-3D -mashups.

One of the many things i can say about this game is: Trippy. It's areally well amde game that is also really addicting. The game has a retro look to it even if it's mostly 3D rendered graphics.  It's a very difficult game and may get you frustrated sometimes, but patience and level memorization are the keys to complete the game.
Good game. Run. Have fun.
very fun and addicting

Awesome game.  It only lacks scratchability. When I am playing this kind of games suddenly I feel all itchy. Geometry dash let me scratch myself when playing because it requires only one hand and this game doesnt. Other than that, nice game.
It Is nice.

Very, very hard. Worst is you want all the achievements. Rage quit is not an option, it is the solution. When games are too hard, it is not a pleasure to play them. I don't recommend it for this reason.

This game is a lot of fun and just challenging enough to ♥♥♥♥ you off. Although it hurts your eyes after a bit. Please don't play this game on fullscreen. Your eyes will start scrolling sideways by themselves. You'll never be able to watch TV again.
Addictive and has an awesome soundtrack.

Could you not get enough of Robot Unicorn Attack but thought that game didn't have complicated enough controls?! Are you masocistic or have enough patience to negotiate a peace deal in the middle east? If so, this is the game for you! The music is nice (not amazing, but nice) but you may be bald by the time you reach the second major zone from all the unfair deaths and trial and error timing gameplay.  This game is only for the most hardcore 2d retro platformer enthusiasts, all three of you!
Addictive as hell. Gives an excellent sense of accomplishment whjen i complete a level, but god damn is it annoying before then.
its in the steam sale they said, it would be fun they said...
You jump and stuff...
wow a game about pixel-perfect timing, memorization, and no midpoints everything i love so much!!!

Ain't nobody got time for that!!!   No checkpoints 1 error, full stage restart everytime Game is only based on memory and reaction time, not fun.  Save yourself the frustration, do not buy..  Uninstall
This game stole trails from the cs series, Gaben sue plz

I can't not recommend this after playing it for almost 30 hours, but make sure it's the kind of game you'd be into. If you don't like games requiring precision timing, nearly perfect platforming skills, or ones that need a real stubornness to get through it then beware because this is exactly that game. Fortunately I'm apparently just that kind of masochistic person! The soundtrack is also excellent and I'm excited to try the sequel next!
replaying and memorising same ♥♥♥♥♥♥ songs over and over again..nope
Now this is a true running game that takes a lot of skill. Even though its very fun, it can also be very challenging.
I love this game. I loved it before it was cool.
I really can't decide whether I like this game or hate it.
0/10 not enough tripping

Trash. The games repetitive levels, lack of checkpoints and 'twitch' platforming combine to create system that punishes you severely for dying even once, and just gets worse and worse from there. An exercise in extreme tedium masked by the pretty aesthetics and retro vibe. I've never lost interest in a game faster.
♥♥♥♥.TRIP RUNNER

7.5/10 Too expensive for endless runner but this game has got enjoyable and crazy music.  Oyunu ilk açınca yapacağınız ilk şey'MÜZİK HARİKA DOSTUM' demek olacaktır.BİT.TRİP RUNNER runner oyunları kategorisinde çok iyi bir yerde ancak oyunun fiyatı kendi değerinde değil.Oyunun oynanışından bahsedelim biz uzaylıyız 2D bir ortamda kendisi otomatik koşarken biz engellerden zıplayıp eğiliyoruz.Oyun grafikleri Pixel olabilir ama bu daha eğlence katıyor eğer ki oyun 3D olsaydı beğenmeyebilirdim.Oyunun en nefret ettiğim tarafı 9.99$ olması .Altı üstü bir endless runner!Oyun indirime girerse kesinlikle alınması gerekn bir runner oyunu

While the start is good, gameplay very quickly becomes extremely frustrating and repetitive. I consider myself a hardcore gamer (platinum god on binding of isaac, 100% on VVVVVV, completed syobon and IWBTG), but this game made me just shut it down and uninstall it.  Not recommended due to extremely unbalanced difficulty.
Fun. Addicting. Timewaster. That sums it up. BUY IT!
Do you want to feel nauseated and want to rip out your own eyeballs while creating the sound of your own demise? Yes? Well then buy this game.
This game has ruined my life... I love it! 10/10.

a great game and worth the price. It is rhythmic based platforming side scroller that is PERFECT for playing 15-30 minutes at a time all the while being very satisfying and at times fustrating. Just try not to play it for too long. Once you start to get angry its a good time to stop playing. The music in it is pretty sick as well with sort of a more modernized style of the 8 bit music from 80's. The greatness comes into effect when you really aren't inputing commands in the way you would go about typical platforming but instead each jump, crouch, kick, and block becomes a note as you conduct a musical showpiece with your fingertips.
If you can make it five minutes without dieing in this game I will give you a handjob, this game put my rage lvl at about a Michael from Achevment Hunter if you know who that is
JUST PRESS THE SPACEBAR, MAN!
The only game I hate so much I have to keep playing

Frustratingly difficult in comparison to the sequel. That's why I love it. This one is definitely for the retroheads that like a game that is innately difficult but is comprised of rather simple gameplay. This is Shenmue's QTE meets Audiosurf's beat-oriented gameplay with some sort of railshooter strain of Pitfall mixed in for good measure. I owned this on the Wii and bought it again for Steam. A+
Easy to get into rhythmic platformer.
Fun, addictive gameplay. Worth your money =)
Really fun game for only $4.99. Check it out if you haven't already!

This is a masterpiece. The game, although seemly simple, is very complex in feelings and gameplay. It tells the life since the fecundation of sperm and egg, to death, of a character named Commander Video..who is only a man. Music Platforming guides you though this incredible voyage, as every move you make adds to the soundtrack, you can play your own music while you jump. Highly reflexive platformer, fast, addictive..pure art.

This game, with its chip-tune rhythmic beats and annoyingly, yet somehow fun difficult platforming levels make you smile and scream at the same time. I usually don't like platformers, but the beats and beautiful environments are just too good to pass up. I personally think this game is a must-play.
best olympic game since sonic and mario
Really addicting, but hard sometimes :D
Do not like. Still though interesting approach to a game, I just wish it has less of a punishment for failing to dodge an obsticle. 2/10
Got me raging in no time... 10/10
Rhythm game need good music. Bit.trip Runner have good music. Bit.trip Runner good game.
This game was made in hell.

This game is legendary, i suspect the brutal difficulty in Bit.Trip Runner will be polarizing, some will find the challenge exciting, and some will find it too stressful. My personal experience occupies something of a 'sweet spot' in the middle.
A nice 'learn how' to control your anger, and avoid destroying some of your hardware (or furniture in some cases).

It's challenging and has cool music that goes with the gameplay, but even though it says it has 'just one more time gameplay' it tends to be more frustrating than a similarly challenging game like Super Meat Boy. This game's alright but in my opinion, you can live without it.
I GET So MAD BUT I ALSO PLEaSURE MYselF AFTER

Classic 'runner' action at its very finest. Stylish graphics, great music, and addictive hardcore tough gameplay. Definitely recommend to those who like challenges. Not recommended to those who like high-tech graphics and easy gameplay.
This game is the most addicting indie game EVER.
Challenging yet super fun!   ...And not forgetting to mention very, very addictive. Great soundtrack too.

Great game, best enjoyed on 'naturally occuring substances which bend your mind'... Like bananas. Yeah, just like bananas. Seriously play this game but don't do drugs kids. *wink* *wink* No seriously, don't.

This game is total ♥♥♥♥. The soundtrack sucks, the levels are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t (so you'll hear the same boring soundtrack over and over as the last 12 levels), and there's absolutely nothing to make this game make sense. Run along and get the gold. Are you meant to be DOING something along the way? Is there a point to all this running and gold? Is there a reason you go into a retro 8-bit forest when you complete a level perfectly? No. There's absolutely nothing going for this game - it's total ♥♥♥♥.  Don't buy this.
Nice retro style platformer, i like the way the music changes with the player's moves. Fun game overall.
A good combo of music and platforming with a hint of rhythm.
Simple, and addictive.

First of all I feel I should say that I hate 'Runner' games. However if you do enjoy 2D runners, I imagine this'll be like all the rest of 'em. Note: I'd recommend using either Num5 or a controller for jumping - Not SPACEBAR as I found (at least with my k/b) a few timing issues with it.
Better than Bit.Trip Beat and insanely addictive.
cool game. cool music

Pretty simple running game with cool visuals and nice music. Its actually pretty challenging because of how fast it goes. It doesn't give you much time to react.   Its a pretty fun game to play when you are waiting for your friends to finish something in Pokemon so they can save and then come online to play League of Legends with you.

LANDSCAPE DRIVEN JUMPS N' SLIDES ON A 4/♥♥♥♥ BEAT. KICK YOURSELF INTO SUBMISSION AND LEARN THAT ART IMITATES LIFE BECAUSE FRUSTRATION IS ONLY PATIENCE IN DISGUISE. GO RUN INTO AN ELECTRIC FENCE AND DANCE FOR FURTHER ENJOYMENT. (-3+5)/10
Need some delicious retro inspired simple-to-get-into-yet-hard-to-master gaming goodness? Look no further!
This is a fun 'old school' game who every adult or kid can enjoy...the music is just wonderful
Its great
When my fingers don't work fast enough nearing the end of a level it makes me want to headbutt a pencil that is standing upright on my desk.
Yeahhhhhno. Does it get better after the first two levels? One-key games are not fun.
Very funny and challenging
This game... is too hard.
My eyes, the googles did nothing.. Allright game if you like a challenge

If you've ever gotten that fresh 'butterflies' feeling in Guitar Hero / Rock Band, play this. I played 1-9 on Normal difficulty for 2 hours straight, my heart thudding in my chest with each glorious failure. It is sublime.

This game is a MUST. In my opinion I don't classify many people gamers unless they have atleast tried the Bit. Trip series. Its an amazing series with one of the greatest characters ever. COMMANDER VIDEO. This game has awesome music from ANAMANAGUCHI Amazing Platforming styles and awesome battles and level design. It makes me love some developers that go back to a old style and keep it still awesome. 10/10 Literally a Perfect Game.
Commander Video. Making a cool beat one again. The music is great, and pixels make it nice to watch. Above all, it's frusturating. I like it.

Definitely feels retro, though going as far as making text so square that you can't even read your score kind of sucks. You don't really need a lot of 'skill' to play this game, but rather a good memory and a lot of patience. Constant trial and error is why this game is not particular enjoyable. The developers tried to incorporate music into levels which would give you an indicator as to how well you run (avoiding obstacles and getting gold). It would seem this feature require some further tweaking before getting what i assume to be the desired effect. However, some of the music in the game (in the menu and background during levels) is really good and definitely adds to the whole retro feeling. Strange, strange hardcore people might enjoy this game. Most will not.
If you like to push buttons while music plays and a small simulation of a person runs around avoiding obstacles, this game is for you.
This game man. This game.
It has lots of running to the right!

A tremendous execution of a simple concept. The visuals are superb, in their funky 3D-2D kind of way, and the music is brilliantly entwined with the gameplay. You essentially have to run along an obstacle course, and the better you do, the nicer the sound gets. It's very rhythmic, so those who don't find music to be a particularly strong point of theirs, this game will be tough. In fact, even though I am a relatively good musician (I play a few instruments) this game was exceptionally difficult. I recommend to all to try to play!

It started as a simple Winter achievement but Bit.Trip Runner quickly turned into one of the most frustrating platformers I've ever played. That's not to say it's bad or anything, it just happens to get incredibly intense when it comes to memorization and pixel perfect execution in the last levels. If your intent is to complete it on Perfect mode you better borrow some Balls of Steel. Just to be one the safe side when controller-snapping frustration kicks in.
It is just an on-a-rail platformer, but the graphics and audio create a beautiful and fun experience.

Follow the life of the Commander, from his birth, to his childhood and then adulthood. Flashbacks of the Vietnam war haunt the Commander as he finds comfort in the use of hallucinogens.  Will the Commander manage to save himself and overcome the trauma, or will he slip and take his own life? Or maybe, the only escape is death...

'Awww this is nice, It's actually not as annoying as the impossible game or super meat boy. Oh, I hit that block thing.. what? I DIDNT HIT THAT! ♥♥♥♥ THIS GAME!!!'  Thats what it feels like and the music is comforting for the first 10 minutes, then it seems as if it is laughing at your through its 8-bit tones.
Not a platformer but a memorization game, basically. It's very frustrating but can be rewarding when you win. Feels like brain training. Excellent music.

So, BIT TRIP RUNNER is a Platform Game.  You play with your character, Commander Video.  You crash on a mysterious planet, and keep heading forward. You have to avoid obstacles, like it was a Marathon. If you hit one, you go back to the start.  Wich each obstacle or jump, you produce sound, that eventually turns into a song.  As you go to through the levels, it gets more interesting and addicting.  Its a great game, even though frustrating at times from hitting obstracles, its great fun! Get it!
SAME CONCEPT AS BEAT  JUST KIDDING YOU GOTTA RUN NOW  DON'T FALL OR HIT ANYTHING OR YOU'LL FEEL BAD AND WANT TO START AGAIN.
The only game in my library that genuinely hurts to play. If you don't like getting eye exams, this is the game for you.

Jump away into LSD madness! Except, this isn't madness. Neither is it an illegal substance. This....is.....BIT.TRIP!!!  Disclaimer: the four badges based on playing through all the special bonus levels are inhuman. I'm very much human and happen to like my dark coloured hair, so I won't be getting those. But damn, the game was funtastic.   V e r d i c t : AWESOMESAUCE, which means nearly perfect

I would recommend this game to anyone.  This game makes you rage very easily, sobe prepared to throw your controller at the wall or smash your PC with a hammer.  There's just something so charming about this game. I don't know what it is though.  Seriously, this game has no flaws.  EVERYONE should get this game.
ONLY if you want to rage the hardest you've ever raged while having the highest high of your life...

This game has three difficulty modes, referred to in-game as 'Easy', 'Normal', and 'Perfect' - more commonly known as 'ETA 5 Seconds Until The Computer Goes Out Of The Window', 'Blindfolded Dark Souls on Acid', and 'Please, Please, Please Let Me Just Die Now'.  However, when you finally do complete a level (on the ten zillionth attempt) you feel like Samuel L. Jackson.
Perfect!
Nice game!
classic memorize-the-level-and-press-buttons-accordingly-and-quickly game I'm a sucker for the aduio and visuals tho  5/10
This game will build you up and break you down and do it over and over again. It's an emotional rollercoaster.

I absolutly love it. Either you're up to the challenge of playing a flawless game, or you're not and get sent back to the start of the level. The restart happens fast, so you don't have to wallow in your failure for more than a few seconds which I find lessens the sting of a missed jump. Having a solid attention span and finely controlled twitch reflexes are essential.
One of my new favorite games! Also doing this for the summer camp thing because who doesn't like free tickets?

Why I bought the game: Bundle  What I liked about the game: This was one of my first indie bundle games that sat in my library for a while collecting dust. I am glad I tried it out, it's a simple game, you have a few commands, jump, kick, slide - what makes the game fun and not just some lame jump side scroll is the perpetual movement, mixed with positive reinforcement with sound activated moments upon collecting certain items. This is an awesome tablet or phone game as well, easy to pick up and let go, overall I love BIT TRIP and it's become a staple game for steam for me.   What I didn't like about the game: The game is not easy, this isn't a bad thing - it just gets frustrating, so if you get frustrated easily this game is not for you.   Would I buy at current asking price of 9.99? It's cuyrrently on sale for .99 cents, which is normally is on sale or found in bundles. It's worth a play for a sale price.  **Disclaimer** I would like to state all changes made by the developers of the game after this review could potentially make this entire review irrelevant.  The current date of review 11/28./14
A strange mix between rhythm game and platformer, the game's simple controls and retro flavor hide a game that's surprisingly challenging and a whole lot of fun. I suggest playing with a controller.
Cool game, but a bit too repeatable. Story 6/10 Gameplay 8/10 Graphics 9,5/10 Music 9/10 Overall 7/10
I'd write a serious review, like I usually do, but I want to know how on earht this guy never runs out of breath. That's like, MEGA stamina!!
Awsome game!!! Nothin like an old school 8.bit game. THAT WILL BLOW YOUR MIND AWAY. Also has a cool soundtrack
Sometimes I sing to the tunes and it makes the game that much more enjoyable.   Also I love collecting gold. I recommend it for anyone who enjoys not digging for gold.
i got so to 1-11 and it took me forever to do so! I come on the next day all status gone. WTF

Jump! Duck! Its all in your mind! Play as the amazing CAPITAN VIDEO and hit buttons to the beat to crash through the warped levels of this ICE COLD VIDYA GAME! The music, the trippy visuals, the twitch-based gameplay. Its all good!
Bit.Trip Beat is frustrating and boring. This one, on the other hand, is a masterpiece of audio-visual interactive software.
This is a frustration fun 2-D plattformer, prepare to get angry at this game.
It's for a short amount of money for a short amount of play-time. Unless you are a completionist type of gamer, this game will probably have a max 2 hours of gameplay.
Pepsi man and guitar hero had a child. A pretty tough one.
I don't usually play rythem games, but this is an exception. Colorful, smooth platforming, and enticing music.

+ Trippy '8-bit'-style visuals + Catchy soundtrack + EASY mode added in the Steam edition, where there aren't any gold bars to collect  – Rage-inducing difficulty (e.g. if you crash into an obstacle, you restart the entire level)
Super stylish rhythm game, make your own chiptunes soundtrack by jumping over and ducking under a whole bunch of things. Very hard, but very addictive.
This game makes me want to kill myself, but... In a good way. I guess.
OMG it's like music and jumping and the most headache inducing game ever. A++ would play again.
A gleeful experience of repeated facepalming, joyous free running.
There's nothing really wrong with this game, but there isn't a lot right. A mediocre rhythm game. If you own it, hopefully it came as part of a bundle you purchased for some other game within.

This game is awesome, and I really enjoy the great colors. Simple controls but challenging to hit them quickly in exact sequence sometimes. I listen to the soundtrack at work sometimes because I like the music so much.
Can be very difficult and but it's worth it for the soundtrack alone. Played it a lot on the Wii many moons ago and just had to get it on Steam as well.
This game combines elements of rhythm and platforming in an elegant way. The controls are simple, but the gameplay is never boring.
My hands hurt.
Rhythm platformer.
